commit_message:
Do not allow to run 2 or more tasks simultaneously

Simultaneous run of 2 or tasks may cause
side-effects and the simplest way is prevent this action.
Also fixed all places where rpc.cast called without commit

Change-Id: I029768900d345540c3b501f1fa3649b063d3a55d
Partial-Bug: 1615557

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 16:47:49.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/baremetal/tasks/append_to_etc_hosts.yml', 'ansible/roles/baremetal/tasks/pre-install.yml'], 'message': "Limit hostfile generation to control nodes

With current implementation generation of hostfile is N^2, let's at

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I15f8d98386ede8bbc89f66923f21547efe20ff37
"}]
commit_message:
Limit hostfile generation to control nodes

With current implementation generation of hostfile is N^2, let's at
least limit this to controller nodes. Currently only RabbitMQ requires
hostnames, and these lands on control.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I15f8d98386ede8bbc89f66923f21547efe20ff37

subject: Use openjdk isntead of oracle jdk
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-31 13:59:09.000000000', 'files': ['install/storlets/prepare_storlets_install.sh', 'Engine/SBus/SBusJavaFacade/build.xml', 'doc/source/engine_dev_installation.rst', 'install/storlets/roles/docker_base_jre_image/templates/ubuntu_14.04_jre8_Dockerfile'], 'message': "Use openjdk isntead of oracle jdk

We've used oracle jdk as a java runtime to run storlet java codes,
but it is not necesorry to use oracle jdk, and from some legal points
of view, it is better to use openjdk instead.

This patch makes changes to current scripts and files for installation,
to make them use openjdk.

NOTE:
Currently we add ppa:openjdk-r/ppa into apt repositoriy setting, but
we don't need that addition when we use Ubuntu 14.10 or later.

Closes-bug: #1618895
Change-Id: I4c65afd4edf6b0d8b5f5f83307a8129e67c2911d
"}]
commit_message:
Use openjdk isntead of oracle jdk

We've used oracle jdk as a java runtime to run storlet java codes,
but it is not necesorry to use oracle jdk, and from some legal points
of view, it is better to use openjdk instead.

This patch makes changes to current scripts and files for installation,
to make them use openjdk.

NOTE:
Currently we add ppa:openjdk-r/ppa into apt repositoriy setting, but
we don't need that addition when we use Ubuntu 14.10 or later.

Closes-bug: #1618895
Change-Id: I4c65afd4edf6b0d8b5f5f83307a8129e67c2911d

commit_message:
Moving of Quotas scenarios into separate classes

This patch moving methods from Quotas' base classe into several independed classes
(by one on each method) with keeping of original names of scenarios.
Also this patch contains updated unit tests for all scenarios

subject: Config logABug feature for Keystone api-ref
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-31 06:17:28.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Config logABug feature for Keystone api-ref

Currently, Keystone api-ref is not configured with logABug feature.
When users click "Report bug" button, it leads to
"bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals" which is default.
We should change it to "bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/"

Change-Id: I8d6fc4d2a6ab9d7f444a02cbc2f756fdaa3de264
'}]
commit_message:
Config logABug feature for Keystone api-ref

Currently, Keystone api-ref is not configured with logABug feature.
When users click "Report bug" button, it leads to
"bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals" which is default.
We should change it to "bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/"

Change-Id: I8d6fc4d2a6ab9d7f444a02cbc2f756fdaa3de264

commit_message:
Fix identation in nova.image

Currently identation in nova.image and related tests
looks ugly and doesn't comply with common pep8 guidelines.
This commit fixes it and makes nova.image code more
beautiful. Also test fixtures were moved under the
test class because they are reauired only there and some
typos are fixed.

Change-Id: I8505fc37a5a029c6ef3cbcc950f212c8347677ea

commit_message:
Make api-ref bug link point to nova

The openstackdocstheme includes a bug reference link, which defaults
to openstack manuals. We want to update this to be a Nova bug instead.

This also cleans up the pre openstackdocstheme support code

Change-Id: Iace4619c37b04b1504a7051e9e5274b2a3b77c24

commit_message:
Add test to validate the error strings in test_expirer

Improve test_get_process_values_* methods in obj/test_expirer in the
form assertRaises(ValueError, x.get_process_values,{}/vals), to use
the assertRaises context form.  This improves understandability by
validateing the error strings in addition to the ValueError.

Related-Change: I3d12b79470d122b2114f9ee486b15d381f290f95

Change-Id: I1c66b8894cba8328d19cf99491a8ad18ded71078

This commit adds two small changes in Glare API:
1. For setting custom locations we're going to use
   our own content type
   'application/glare-external-location' instead of
   'application/json'.
2. 'content-type' is a required property for all blobs.

Change-Id: I2263b52932b7f23b46afe42f68589e2a0833bcee
"}]
commit_message:
Update Glare API spec

This commit adds two small changes in Glare API:
1. For setting custom locations we're going to use
   our own content type
   'application/glare-external-location' instead of
   'application/json'.
2. 'content-type' is a required property for all blobs.

Change-Id: I2263b52932b7f23b46afe42f68589e2a0833bcee

subject: Refresh puppet module symlinks after every package update
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-17 13:25:56.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_block_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/update_upgrade_functions.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_controller_pacemaker_1.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_object_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_init.yaml', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_ceph_storage.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_compute.sh', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': "Refresh puppet module symlinks after every package update

This adds create_openstack_puppet_modules_symlinks function and calls it
after each package update, to ensure that newly installed modules can be
found by Puppet.

Suggestion that the symlinks should be handled by OPM packaging received
pushback that such solution doesn't fit all use cases for the OPM
package.

A somewhat specific issue are the scripts for nodes which don't execute
the upgrade right away from Heat, but only write out a script for later
execution. There we need to pass along the function definition of
create_openstack_puppet_modules_symlinks using `declare -f`. (Using
deployment artifacts for something like this could collide with the
user-specific use cases for deployment artifact parameters.)

Closes-Bug: #1613211
Change-Id: I60201b45e4f8d823f4e216503fb218fd8e36d73c
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh puppet module symlinks after every package update

This adds create_openstack_puppet_modules_symlinks function and calls it
after each package update, to ensure that newly installed modules can be
found by Puppet.

Suggestion that the symlinks should be handled by OPM packaging received
pushback that such solution doesn't fit all use cases for the OPM
package.

A somewhat specific issue are the scripts for nodes which don't execute
the upgrade right away from Heat, but only write out a script for later
execution. There we need to pass along the function definition of
create_openstack_puppet_modules_symlinks using `declare -f`. (Using
deployment artifacts for something like this could collide with the
user-specific use cases for deployment artifact parameters.)

Closes-Bug: #1613211
Change-Id: I60201b45e4f8d823f4e216503fb218fd8e36d73c

Change-Id: I5e3319e92dbf7877df8db5a4a64aac9490196f2d

commit_message:
Glare

Glare (from GLance Artifact REpository) is a service that
provides access to a unified catalog of structured
meta-information as well as related binary data
(these structures are also called 'artifacts').

Glare offers its users a number of important features, like:
 * Custom assets — it's not just images anymore, but also Heat
   templates, Murano packages, Mistral workbooks, Tacker
   blueprints and so on.
 * Artifacts versioning — each artifact can be supplemented
   with the version in SemVer format.
 * Support of multiple binary objects per artifact. From
   Glare’s part, it allows to specify a set of such attributes.
 * Structured properties — artifacts may contain structured
   properties like ‘dict’ and ‘list’.
 * Dependencies between artifacts — one artifact may depend on
   the other.
 * Additional filtering for artifacts with various operators.
 * Importing/exporting of artifacts between clouds.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darja Shakhray <dshakhray@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I5e3319e92dbf7877df8db5a4a64aac9490196f2d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-26 14:06:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/metadata/config.py'], 'message': "Fix metadata agent config when using SSL

The metadata agent (neutron-metadata-agent) is receiving requests from
metadata proxies in namespaces (neutron-ns-metadata-proxy) through a
UNIX socket. The requests there are always plain HTTP and since it's not
going through the network, it's fine.

However, if [DEFAULT] use_ssl in neutron.conf is set to true, then
neutron-metadata-agent inherits this and expects HTTPS on this UNIX
socket too. So always override this setting.

Change-Id: I3b3ed56fd318e10d4a5668c86e36a4c0f87c5cc5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix metadata agent config when using SSL

The metadata agent (neutron-metadata-agent) is receiving requests from
metadata proxies in namespaces (neutron-ns-metadata-proxy) through a
UNIX socket. The requests there are always plain HTTP and since it's not
going through the network, it's fine.

However, if [DEFAULT] use_ssl in neutron.conf is set to true, then
neutron-metadata-agent inherits this and expects HTTPS on this UNIX
socket too. So always override this setting.

Change-Id: I3b3ed56fd318e10d4a5668c86e36a4c0f87c5cc5

commit_message:
Don't use config option sqlite_db

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated in
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and
deprecate argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350945/, should use
config option connection instead.

Change-Id: If21c6bbdd83c31a27c73182160038115106c87df

commit_message:
Cinder get-capabilities tests

Cinder allows getting capabilities for a storage back end

Added:
- Api for get-capabilities
- Documentation reference for cinder show_pools

Tests:
- Test get capabilities for a given back end
- Test get volume stats
Note: Only admin has the privileges to perform get-capabilities action,
by default.

Change-Id: I1329a1339e1d8526f94ee57fb0ab43a78d881174

commit_message:
Do not create sahara templates anymore

This patch removes creation of sahara templates during Sahara
installation, as it doesn't have any end-user benefits.

Also Sahara templates relies that all Nova flavor already created,
but since I80b63ce1ebca01be61ac0f43d26a2992ecf16678 Nova flavors
will not be automatically created.

Change-Id: Ic32f8f1a9112804bfbf847855e13510e504cc6b5
Closes-bug: #1603939

commit_message:
Fix restore exception handling

Re-raise exception in restore so that higher
level excption handling can occur. Specifically
rich_queue needs to be closed when an exception
is encountered.

Fixes Bug: #1609094

Change-Id: Ib4d71f85b0c1f14bdd8980b35f23f351df176763
(cherry picked from commit 819a5c14e81db9ae4c7319ef71d0e9a9d312c599)

gw_address is received in IpamDriver.RequestAddress when create network.
In Docker 1.12+, it will have NETWORK_GATEWAY_OPTIONS, but in lower
docker version, such as 1.9.1, it will not carry this option.
This change check if subnet exist first, this makes it can work for both

Closes-bug: #1611261

commit_message:
RequestAddress when subnet has not been created

gw_address is received in IpamDriver.RequestAddress when create network.
In Docker 1.12+, it will have NETWORK_GATEWAY_OPTIONS, but in lower
docker version, such as 1.9.1, it will not carry this option.
This change check if subnet exist first, this makes it can work for both
docker version.

Change-Id: I1c741172e927179f83284e8a23afce5f07b130f9
Closes-bug: #1611261

commit_message:
Move valuable API info from neutron-specs repo

This information is stored (unlinked) in neutron-specs repo under
misc/api/networking_general_api_information.rst This patch just moves
the contents into api-ref, where they seem to belong.

Note that the contents are not current in some parts. For example, it is
said there XML format of requests is still supported, which is not true
for quite a while. This contents will be cleaned up in follow up
patches. For now, I keep the text intact to ease reviewer's life.

Adding two documentation bugs to be closed by the patch because the
information missing in api-ref is already included in the bits copied by
this patch.

Closes-Bug: #1609934
Closes-Bug: #1609932
Change-Id: Ic0c2348d7db941deaec6e1d110954fe5893c2265

subject: api-ref: introduced a stub sub-page to cover general info
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 13:14:13.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2/intro.inc', 'api-ref/source/v2/index.rst'], 'message': "api-ref: introduced a stub sub-page to cover general info

Apart from specifics of features like L2 or L3 or QoS API, there should
be a separate place to contain general information about how to use
Neutron API. This patch introduces an empty stub sub-page for just that.
Follow-up patches will expand with details.

Things like sorting and pagination behaviour, or authentication, or
headers, are good candidates for this sub-page, because they are in most
cases not resource specific but cover the whole Neutron API. It's better
to keep those details in a single place instead of duplicating the
information for each new resource.

Change-Id: Ib04b18bf9e872fd2471a7f3dda3853349063761a
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: introduced a stub sub-page to cover general info

Apart from specifics of features like L2 or L3 or QoS API, there should
be a separate place to contain general information about how to use
Neutron API. This patch introduces an empty stub sub-page for just that.
Follow-up patches will expand with details.

Things like sorting and pagination behaviour, or authentication, or
headers, are good candidates for this sub-page, because they are in most
cases not resource specific but cover the whole Neutron API. It's better
to keep those details in a single place instead of duplicating the
information for each new resource.

Change-Id: Ib04b18bf9e872fd2471a7f3dda3853349063761a

commit_message:
Add 'fuel2 env reset' command

As we deprecate old cli a new 'fuel2 env reset' command
should be implemented for new cli. This patch:
 * adds 'fuel2 env reset' command
 * implements '--force' flag

   usage: fuel2 env reset [-h] [-f] id

DocImpact
Change-Id: I1abd5db673a4c613d48fb19218b11201f9f20311

commit_message:
Add unit case

"op" has three judgments in ReplicatorRpc.dispatch, rsync_then_merge,complete_rsync
and other. But it only has two times judgments,including rsync_then_merge and other
in test_REPLICATE_works, so I add complete_rsync in test_account and test_container

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 12817, 'name': 'Sergiy Kulanov', 'email': 'sergey@kulanov.org.ua', 'username': 'skulanov'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-28 15:34:09.000000000', 'files': ['iso/bootstrap_admin_node.sh'], 'message': "bootstrap_admin_node: Fix connectivity check.

After Fuel Master builds the bootstrap image at first boot,
internet connectivity is tested using the URL for the CentOS
updates repository.

bootstrap_admin_node.sh script parses the output of `yum repolist`,
looking for entries like 'Repo-baseurl: http://...'.

However, in Fuel 9.0, <updates> points to a mirrorlist file (a text
file containing a list of possible mirror URLs) instead of being
a single, direct link to the repository.

For now, we only test that we can access the mirrorlist file,
while the check should be performed against the mirror(s).

Old (Fuel 8) repo entry format:
Repo-baseurl: http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/.../updates/x86_64/

New (Fuel 9) mirrorlist format:
Repo-mirrors: http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/.../mos-mirrors-updates.txt

Closes-Bug: #1596981

Change-Id: I21268dd8aa8cd633f09f921b4a9e1c057a4b8ed3
Signed-off-by: Alexandru Avadanii <Alexandru.Avadanii@enea.com>
"}]
commit_message:
bootstrap_admin_node: Fix connectivity check.

After Fuel Master builds the bootstrap image at first boot,
internet connectivity is tested using the URL for the CentOS
updates repository.

bootstrap_admin_node.sh script parses the output of `yum repolist`,
looking for entries like 'Repo-baseurl: http://...'.

However, in Fuel 9.0, <updates> points to a mirrorlist file (a text
file containing a list of possible mirror URLs) instead of being
a single, direct link to the repository.

For now, we only test that we can access the mirrorlist file,
while the check should be performed against the mirror(s).

Old (Fuel 8) repo entry format:
Repo-baseurl: http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/.../updates/x86_64/

New (Fuel 9) mirrorlist format:
Repo-mirrors: http://mirror.fuel-infra.org/.../mos-mirrors-updates.txt

Closes-Bug: #1596981

Change-Id: I21268dd8aa8cd633f09f921b4a9e1c057a4b8ed3
Signed-off-by: Alexandru Avadanii <Alexandru.Avadanii@enea.com>

Sync tools/tox_install.sh with python-openstackclient. This brings in

  I939eae82dba3287fd4e4086128ebf4609a0e0770).

commit_message:
Sync tools/tox_install.sh

Sync tools/tox_install.sh with python-openstackclient. This brings in
the following improvements:

* Do not leave temporary directory around, instead delete temporary
  directory directly after usage (change
  I939eae82dba3287fd4e4086128ebf4609a0e0770).
* Do not set ZUUL_BRANCH explicitely and remove unused if condition
  (change I0077c986a17d6bb92791474e03d1e77776e9382f).

Change-Id: I1f6abd8a2d86d3f4641462bcb77e2d2ab892076f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-15 16:26:26.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'unit_tests/test_upgrade_roll.py'], 'message': 'Allow multiple rolling upgrades

The rolling upgrade code sets keys in the ceph monitor
cluster to discover whether it can upgrade itself. This
patch addresses an issue where the upgrade code was not
taking into account multiple upgrades to newer ceph versions
in a row.

Closes-Bug: 1611719
Change-Id: Icc7c2f48517b9b4bc7d6526e2c89756341296054
'}]
commit_message:
Allow multiple rolling upgrades

The rolling upgrade code sets keys in the ceph monitor
cluster to discover whether it can upgrade itself. This
patch addresses an issue where the upgrade code was not
taking into account multiple upgrades to newer ceph versions
in a row.

Closes-Bug: 1611719
Change-Id: Icc7c2f48517b9b4bc7d6526e2c89756341296054

commit_message:
Add option to support dhcp/l3 agent ha

New option enable_neutron_agent_ha added to enable/disable dhcp/l3 agent
high availability, dhcp_agents_per_network is default to 2 and it's
configurable.

Implement blueprint: support-network-ha

Change-Id: Id4742aa67c80584634b923195545bf2b654172f3

commit_message:
Mask unimplemented properties for health policy

There are some properties we haven't implemented for the health policy.
This patch masks them temporarily so that the released policy is always
a working one.

Change-Id: I75bb49448f33e3c9addcfffcac0ec0a8cade696f

subject: Create per-role node_names in hieradata for all nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-23 17:09:28.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud.yaml', 'puppet/all-nodes-config.yaml'], 'message': "Create per-role node_names in hieradata for all nodes

Stop special-casing the controller, so we can break the link between
the service configurations which require a list of either names
or IPs - this is the first step where we'll deploy the list of
names for all roles, next we'll deploy the list of services enabled
for each role, so we can calculate stuff like galera_node_names in
puppet-tripleo instead of hard-coding it here.

Change-Id: Ib311bb0f35d68c719bdd408fb330224eaf6669c0
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
"}]
commit_message:
Create per-role node_names in hieradata for all nodes

Stop special-casing the controller, so we can break the link between
the service configurations which require a list of either names
or IPs - this is the first step where we'll deploy the list of
names for all roles, next we'll deploy the list of services enabled
for each role, so we can calculate stuff like galera_node_names in
puppet-tripleo instead of hard-coding it here.

Change-Id: Ib311bb0f35d68c719bdd408fb330224eaf6669c0
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles

subject: Update repo source download to use processed requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 12:35:27.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/repo_set_facts.yml', 'templates/op-pip-download-script.sh.j2', 'tasks/repo_build.yml'], 'message': 'Update repo source download to use processed requirements

Previously the requirements were processed multiple times - once
to build requirements.txt and another to download the pip sources.

This patch ensures that the processed requirements.txt is used to
download the pip sources to ensure that the processing only happens
once and that the downloaded sources are accurate and complete.

Change-Id: I8d056668208a09ec61d318bd67f29cbf32f3b195
'}]
commit_message:
Update repo source download to use processed requirements

Previously the requirements were processed multiple times - once
to build requirements.txt and another to download the pip sources.

This patch ensures that the processed requirements.txt is used to
download the pip sources to ensure that the processing only happens
once and that the downloaded sources are accurate and complete.

Change-Id: I8d056668208a09ec61d318bd67f29cbf32f3b195

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-30 12:23:27.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/datasources/cinder/volume/driver.py', 'vitrage/datasources/nova/instance/driver.py', 'vitrage/datasources/services.py', 'vitrage/datasources/rescheduler.py', 'vitrage/datasources/__init__.py', 'vitrage/datasources/driver_base.py', 'vitrage/tests/unit/datasources/test_rescheduler_functions.py'], 'message': "ReScheduler class for Vitrage Snapshot Service

The ReScheduler is a decorating class to Python's
sched package Scheduler. Allows scheduling tasks for a
repeated number of times while providing a mechanism
to reschedule differently in case of a task's
failure. The class is now used to reschedule repeatedly

Change-Id: I3f6131a7e1d2750405ddeed5575976d5a486a08d

commit_message:
ReScheduler class for Vitrage Snapshot Service

The ReScheduler is a decorating class to Python's
sched package Scheduler. Allows scheduling tasks for a
repeated number of times while providing a mechanism
to reschedule differently in case of a task's
failure. The class is now used to reschedule repeatedly
Vitrage's datasources get_all. This allows for better
get all exception\fault management as well as more
options for timing them.

Change-Id: I3f6131a7e1d2750405ddeed5575976d5a486a08d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-07 16:26:08.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_plugin_builder/actions/build.py', 'fuel_plugin_builder/tests/test_build.py'], 'message': 'Support multi versions of package in fuel plugin

Some plugins may have repeating packages, which are currently filtered
by dpkg-scanpackages. This is the case for multiarch builds of some Fuel
plugins like ODL, which build and ship both amd64 and arm64 DEBs for ODL
prereqs. Allow multiple versions of a single package, by passing the
`-m` flag to dpkg-scanpackages when building local Ubuntu repo.

Closes-Bug: #1599896

Change-Id: Iba6442d2f21b252769ae30b2af01bbb04e16fd4c
Signed-off-by: Guo Ruijing <ruijing.guo@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Support multi versions of package in fuel plugin

Some plugins may have repeating packages, which are currently filtered
by dpkg-scanpackages. This is the case for multiarch builds of some Fuel
plugins like ODL, which build and ship both amd64 and arm64 DEBs for ODL
prereqs. Allow multiple versions of a single package, by passing the
`-m` flag to dpkg-scanpackages when building local Ubuntu repo.

Closes-Bug: #1599896

Change-Id: Iba6442d2f21b252769ae30b2af01bbb04e16fd4c
Signed-off-by: Guo Ruijing <ruijing.guo@intel.com>

subject: Fixed hosts inclusion when requiring the lxc_hosts role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 04:58:05.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-hosts-setup.yml', 'playbooks/common-plays/generate-lxc-container-hosts.yml'], 'message': 'Fixed hosts inclusion when requiring the lxc_hosts role

The lxc host role was being pinned to specific hosts under the assumption
that only those host types would ever run lxc containers. This becomes an
issue when the host groups have been used outside of our "nornal" pattern
used in the gate. Simple changes to the "openstack_user_config.yml" file
can cause containers to be built in hosts not covered by our current pins.

Common example where the old group would not work:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/565045/

To correct this issue a new play has been added under "common-plays" which
generates a group of known hosts which we know will require the "lxc_host"
role.

Change-Id: I99eb876f1d089a73ae162f5629422dc492a99d09
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed hosts inclusion when requiring the lxc_hosts role

The lxc host role was being pinned to specific hosts under the assumption
that only those host types would ever run lxc containers. This becomes an
issue when the host groups have been used outside of our "nornal" pattern
used in the gate. Simple changes to the "openstack_user_config.yml" file
can cause containers to be built in hosts not covered by our current pins.

Common example where the old group would not work:
  http://paste.openstack.org/show/565045/

To correct this issue a new play has been added under "common-plays" which
generates a group of known hosts which we know will require the "lxc_host"
role.

Change-Id: I99eb876f1d089a73ae162f5629422dc492a99d09
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-17 18:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Exclude USB block devices by the default

All USB storage devices must be filtered by the default as often this
type of devices can be just an emulated temprorary storage for FW
upgrade and so on.

If one wants to get usb block devices reported to nailgun, then
it could be either a cmdline option report_usb_block_devices or
the same option added to the agent' config file.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Id609715732fd0ab393d1557b4810464fbfaf096e
Closes-Bug: #1543221
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude USB block devices by the default

All USB storage devices must be filtered by the default as often this
type of devices can be just an emulated temprorary storage for FW
upgrade and so on.

If one wants to get usb block devices reported to nailgun, then
it could be either a cmdline option report_usb_block_devices or
the same option added to the agent' config file.

DocImpact
Change-Id: Id609715732fd0ab393d1557b4810464fbfaf096e
Closes-Bug: #1543221

subject: Fix nova_ssh container shell to allow instance resizes.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 2834, 'name': 'Steven Dake', 'email': 'steven.dake@gmail.com', 'username': 'sdake'}, {'_account_id': 7488, 'name': 'Jeffrey Zhang', 'email': 'zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jeffrey4l'}, {'_account_id': 9927, 'name': 'Britt Houser', 'email': 'bhouser@cisco.com', 'username': 'britthouser'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 10787, 'name': 'Michal Jastrzebski (inc0)', 'email': 'michal.jastrzebski@intel.com', 'username': 'inc0'}, {'_account_id': 11105, 'name': 'Swapnil Kulkarni', 'email': 'coolsvap@gmail.com', 'username': 'coolsvap'}, {'_account_id': 14103, 'name': 'wangtianfa', 'email': 'wang.tianfa@99cloud.net', 'username': 'wangtianfa'}, {'_account_id': 16233, 'name': 'Mauricio Lima', 'email': 'mauriciolimab@gmail.com', 'username': 'limamauricio'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-31 04:56:52.000000000', 'files': ['docker/nova/nova-ssh/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Fix nova_ssh container shell to allow instance resizes.

According to the configuration reference,
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/compute/resize.html
When using KVM, nova utilizes SSH for instance resizing.
Kolla nova_ssh container has the nova user configured with "/sbin/nologin" shell,
which prevents nova_compute from successfully resizing instances.
Added fix to change shell from nologin to bash.

Change-Id: I46a48e242dae6ee6c9159bc30edd8b823ffbb515
Closes-Bug: 1617902
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova_ssh container shell to allow instance resizes.

According to the configuration reference,
http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/compute/resize.html
When using KVM, nova utilizes SSH for instance resizing.
Kolla nova_ssh container has the nova user configured with "/sbin/nologin" shell,
which prevents nova_compute from successfully resizing instances.
Added fix to change shell from nologin to bash.

Change-Id: I46a48e242dae6ee6c9159bc30edd8b823ffbb515
Closes-Bug: 1617902

commit_message:
Revert "Disable rax-iad due to launch failure rate"

A support ticket to rackspace indicated they didn't find an issue. Re
enable the region so we can generate new servers and update our ticket
with the results.

This reverts commit d4b4db784c9f2976f097138f6b510cab51e6822e.

Change-Id: I492018f6ab3a7a55474ef0de7d6297ca57cd3968
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
introduce bifrost-deploy container

- This change adds support for building and deploying
  a bifrost container for baremetal provisioning.
- This change documents how to manually deploy and bootstrap
  the bifrost container.

Implements: blueprint bifrost-support
Change-Id: I7d895839b11cbf916be33225875465c3358b5aa4

If the network has no segment associated at a particular

commit_message:
Do not warn under normal network circumstances

If the network has no segment associated at a particular
point of its lifecycle, there is no need to emit a warning,
as the operator can do very little with the information
given.

Change-Id: I1263be60c3d73f7825596f5e8e7b918d8076f537
Closes-bug: #1618694

that support hugepage.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-31 11:30:01.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2'], 'message': 'remove the path from the auth_url

Based on the upstream documentation for swift it would seem

commit_message:
remove the path from the auth_url

Based on the upstream documentation for swift it would seem
that the full auth path "http://localhsot:35357/v3" is no
longer needed.

DOC Link: http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/install-guide-ubuntu/swift-controller-install.html

Change-Id: Ie9986e89d5e6198f21e768c57ce18a4e7cbce153
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add reno for deprecation of max_fixed_ips_per_port

This patch adds the release note to increase operator visibility.

The release notes system was not present when this option was
deprecated at the start of the Mitaka cycle so no release note
was created.

Related-Bug: #1502356

subject: Rename package lists (and related vars) appropriately
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-31 09:23:16.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-apt.yml', 'releasenotes/notes/package-list-name-changes-e6f88d12f3bd9fa0.yaml', 'vars/debian.yml'], 'message': 'Rename package lists (and related vars) appropriately

In order to make it easier to differentiate between the lists of
python packages, distribution packages, downloaded packages,
package pins and other similar variables the variable names are
being changed to ensure that they have a more explicit suffix
that defines the purpose and makes the naming more consistent.

This is to facilitate a lookup plugin which will be able to look
up all the package lists and present them as a consolidated piece
of data which may be used for artifact preparation.

Change-Id: I2c0d397df559df1725ec541afd7616e114d49d6f
'}]
commit_message:
Rename package lists (and related vars) appropriately

In order to make it easier to differentiate between the lists of
python packages, distribution packages, downloaded packages,
package pins and other similar variables the variable names are
being changed to ensure that they have a more explicit suffix
that defines the purpose and makes the naming more consistent.

This is to facilitate a lookup plugin which will be able to look
up all the package lists and present them as a consolidated piece
of data which may be used for artifact preparation.

Change-Id: I2c0d397df559df1725ec541afd7616e114d49d6f

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-25 20:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/migrate.cfg', 'nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_models.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/__init__.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/__init__.py', 'nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/fixtures.py', 'releasenotes/notes/placement-database-5aa94ece29eab820.yaml', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/__init__.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/001_initial.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Optional separate database for placement API"

This reverts commit 1b5f9f8203c90fe447d33c89f238104026052d1e.

On IRC I we decided that we agreed no migrations should be placement
specific, we should just use the API table migrations to generate the
schema for both DBs.

There is also a separate debate around the alias for the aggregates
table, but that is not really a reason to revert, its just things in
here that will need rework.

Change-Id: I275945aee9d9be8e35d6ddc05515df39d559457a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Optional separate database for placement API"

This reverts commit 1b5f9f8203c90fe447d33c89f238104026052d1e.

On IRC I we decided that we agreed no migrations should be placement
specific, we should just use the API table migrations to generate the
schema for both DBs.

There is also a separate debate around the alias for the aggregates
table, but that is not really a reason to revert, its just things in
here that will need rework.

Change-Id: I275945aee9d9be8e35d6ddc05515df39d559457a

commit_message:
Add support for an answers file

Adding an --answers-file parameter to overcloud deploy and
overcloud update that takes a YAML file:

   templates: ~/templates
   environments:
     - ~/test-env1.yaml
     - ~/test-env2.yaml
     - ~/test-env3.yaml

Change-Id: I623143924951d02fcc9179c1da7705b4b7b551b7

    - openstack overcloud deploy
    - openstack overcloud node delete
    - openstack overcloud update stack

This removal is due to the limiting nature of Tuskar, we can achieve everything
we need and more without it. The change also removes python-tuskarclient from

required it will need to be installed independently.

This change is dependant on the Tuskar examples being removed from the
documentation. These are removed in the dependant change ID below.

Depends-On: I2d4aa114156c5bafb003e6a67862ed6d1449fd98
Change-Id: Ic6fd4568054fe91b8fc898728022a7d7ed8cf3cf

commit_message:
Remove Tuskar support

This change removes Tuskar support from the following commands:

    - openstack overcloud deploy
    - openstack overcloud node delete
    - openstack overcloud update stack

This removal is due to the limiting nature of Tuskar, we can achieve everything
we need and more without it. The change also removes python-tuskarclient from
the requirements and if the Tuskar CLI (openstack management commands) is
required it will need to be installed independently.

This change is dependant on the Tuskar examples being removed from the
documentation. These are removed in the dependant change ID below.

Depends-On: I2d4aa114156c5bafb003e6a67862ed6d1449fd98
Change-Id: Ic6fd4568054fe91b8fc898728022a7d7ed8cf3cf

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-08-30 14:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/common/_deprecate.py', 'neutron/db/address_scope_db.py', 'tools/list_moved_globals.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/moved_globals_code2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/moved_globals_code1.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_flat.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test__deprecate.py', 'neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/db/subnet_service_type_db_models.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/moved_globals_target.py', 'neutron/db/allowed_address_pairs/models.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/type_gre.py'], 'message': 'debtcollector for globals

The deprecation shim created by Doug turns out to be rather useful.
It emits a warning when an global (attribute of a module) is
referenced but that global has been moved to another module.

This update makes the following changes to the shim:

 - Rename it to _MovedGlobals to better describe what it is a
   debtcollector for.

 - Use inspect to get the original reference and to check that
   _MovedGlobals is called from the last line of a module.

 - Save the old reference automatically in the instance to prevent it
   from getting garbage collected.

 - Beef up the _moved_global() method for moving/renaming individual
   globals, allowing it to move and rename or rename in place.

Change-Id: I868aa4a3129dd05467a103364088efbb86bc5d0f
'}]
commit_message:
debtcollector for globals

The deprecation shim created by Doug turns out to be rather useful.
It emits a warning when an global (attribute of a module) is
referenced but that global has been moved to another module.

This update makes the following changes to the shim:

 - Rename it to _MovedGlobals to better describe what it is a
   debtcollector for.

 - Use inspect to get the original reference and to check that
   _MovedGlobals is called from the last line of a module.

 - Save the old reference automatically in the instance to prevent it
   from getting garbage collected.

 - Beef up the _moved_global() method for moving/renaming individual
   globals, allowing it to move and rename or rename in place.

Change-Id: I868aa4a3129dd05467a103364088efbb86bc5d0f

subject: Run functional-ubuntu-trusty jobs on all branches
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-31 09:43:44.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Run functional-ubuntu-trusty jobs on all branches

* Skip gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge job explicitly for neutron.
  Skip condition of gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge is defined for nova,
  and it seems the generic skip rules '.*tempest-dsvm-*' defined before
  the explicit rule does not work.

Change-Id: Ic39e7b4588f96f2a056ea3eba3ba39931b268e1c
"}]
commit_message:
Update job skip condition for neutron doc-only changes

* Skip python35 job
* Skip python(27|34|35) jobs with suffix like '-ubuntu-xenial'
* Skip gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge job explicitly for neutron.
  Skip condition of gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-linuxbridge is defined for nova,
  and it seems the generic skip rules '.*tempest-dsvm-*' defined before
  the explicit rule does not work.

Change-Id: Ic39e7b4588f96f2a056ea3eba3ba39931b268e1c

commit_message:
Replace map(func, data) with [func(item) for item in data]

Following Python 3 guide https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
Thus, we should replace map(str,cmd) with [str(item) for item in cmd]

Change-Id: I6d2c4504ee1bf61e2719aa5943d489cbd38b45d0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-29 22:05:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Generate new context for each DHCP RPC call

The DHCP agent was using the same context for every RPC
request so it made it difficult to tell server side where one
RPC request began and where another one ended.

This patch has it generate a new context for each RPC request
so they can be tracked independently. In the long term it would
be better if the agent kept the context for server-initiated events
so actions could be tracked end-to-end under the same request-ID.

Change-Id: I1d6dc28ba4752d3f9f1020851af2960859aae520
Closes-Bug: #1618231
'}]
commit_message:
Generate new context for each DHCP RPC call

The DHCP agent was using the same context for every RPC
request so it made it difficult to tell server side where one
RPC request began and where another one ended.

This patch has it generate a new context for each RPC request
so they can be tracked independently. In the long term it would
be better if the agent kept the context for server-initiated events
so actions could be tracked end-to-end under the same request-ID.

Change-Id: I1d6dc28ba4752d3f9f1020851af2960859aae520
Closes-Bug: #1618231

commit_message:
Allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods.

Implements access_policy for dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods.

Implements the following access policies:
* LegacyRPCAccessPolicy
* DefaultRPCAccessPolicy
* ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy

* Implement decorator @rpc.expose for use with the
 ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy

* Modify get_rpc_server to allow optional access_policy argument
* Set default access_policy to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy (Nova exposes
 _associate_floating_ip in tempest tests). Added debtcollector
 notification.
* Add test cases for access_policy=None
* Clarify documentation

Change-Id: I42239e6c8a8be158ddf5c3b1773463b7dc93e881
Closes-Bug: 1194279
Closes-Bug: 1555845

commit_message:
Add volumes/summary API support

Add a new API to display volumes summary with total number of volumes
and total size in GB (total_size: 500 and total_count: 20).

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint display-volumes-summary-details

Co-Authored-By: MR Swami Reddy <swamireddy@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I0117a233afbd834a165ade9e1358f8dd38fbcfac

commit_message:
Add --chassis to 'openstack baremetal node list'

This adds an optional '--chassis <chassis UUID>' to the
'openstack baremetal node list' command. It provides
the ability to get a list of nodes of a specified chassis.

Change-Id: I5dbc0521858823d2e83506b6f873eda9a143f80b
Partial-Bug: #1526479

After devstack installation, to run functional test cases, the
nova instance quota, keypair and neutron port quota should be
set to a level which will not block tests. This patch adds a tool

functional tests locally.

Change-Id: I1c2fae110863906e3f7601456dbf79ff06da4c40

commit_message:
Add a shell script for developers to prepare functional test env

After devstack installation, to run functional test cases, the
nova instance quota, keypair and neutron port quota should be
set to a level which will not block tests. This patch adds a tool
to do this preparation so that developers can easily run
functional tests locally.

Change-Id: I1c2fae110863906e3f7601456dbf79ff06da4c40
Closes-bug: #1617303

subject: Add k8s-docker-suite-app-murano project to openstack
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-30 13:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/k8s-docker-suite-app-murano.config'], 'message': "Add k8s-docker-suite-app-murano project to openstack

As was discussed in mail thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/096458.html
the main aim of this patch to move some applications to separate
repository. It should have the same commit story and be maintained the
same team as early. Current repository contains several groups of
applications:
 - Docker applications, which deploy docker itself.
 - Kubernetes applications, for deploying Kubernetes.
 - Several applications adopted fro runing them in Kubernetes cluster
   mentioned above.

The purpose of current project is to develop and maintain applications
mentioned above. So this project is not a Murano development, it's about
development specific applications, which can be used by Murano.

Also new core group will include murano-apps-core group, because
previously this group maintained these applications.

Change-Id: Ida451ccd2c69590dcf2bfd21977cd1b854626c02
"}]
commit_message:
Add k8s-docker-suite-app-murano project to openstack

As was discussed in mail thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-June/096458.html
the main aim of this patch to move some applications to separate
repository. It should have the same commit story and be maintained the
same team as early. Current repository contains several groups of
applications:
 - Docker applications, which deploy docker itself.
 - Kubernetes applications, for deploying Kubernetes.
 - Several applications adopted fro runing them in Kubernetes cluster
   mentioned above.

The purpose of current project is to develop and maintain applications
mentioned above. So this project is not a Murano development, it's about
development specific applications, which can be used by Murano.

Also new core group will include murano-apps-core group, because
previously this group maintained these applications.

Change-Id: Ida451ccd2c69590dcf2bfd21977cd1b854626c02

commit_message:
networking-midonet: Fix gate_hook check

The check was completely broken. i.e. it tries to check the existence
of the file even before the tree is prepared.

Simply check ZUUL_BRANCH instead.

Closes-Bug: #1552033
Depends-On: I20407b00d47ff2b5119ef5b9f077f6f97683db49
Change-Id: If763f5259e54decb8531df4edac8e58d3064d2b8

subject: Update troves CI jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-30 16:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Update troves CI jobs

Commit [1] updated tox.ini in Trove and took apart the earlier py27
job and made three jobs, a py27, an apiexamples and a fakemodetests
job. This change reflects that in the CI by adding gating jobs for
apiexamples and fakemodetests.

The jobs specify a node-type of ubuntu-xenial so the branch
specification is (strictly speaking) redundant as xenial won't be used
for mitaka/liberty. But, I've left this commit message here only to be
explicit about it and so I don't wonder about it three months from now
when this nugget of information passed through the colander that
claims to be my brain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/362203

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: I69cc5ce233bd330a6d98ffe1598dea0c02a5d7e9
Depends-On: I0a971c6ef6c1a4669490f2aa0e67c795fe86e190
"}]
commit_message:
Update troves CI jobs

Commit [1] updated tox.ini in Trove and took apart the earlier py27
job and made three jobs, a py27, an apiexamples and a fakemodetests
job. This change reflects that in the CI by adding gating jobs for
apiexamples and fakemodetests.

The jobs specify a node-type of ubuntu-xenial so the branch
specification is (strictly speaking) redundant as xenial won't be used
for mitaka/liberty. But, I've left this commit message here only to be
explicit about it and so I don't wonder about it three months from now
when this nugget of information passed through the colander that
claims to be my brain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/362203

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: I69cc5ce233bd330a6d98ffe1598dea0c02a5d7e9
Depends-On: I0a971c6ef6c1a4669490f2aa0e67c795fe86e190

commit_message:
Nested-Containers: Add vlan management apis

These apis will be used by COE specific repos for per container
vlan-id allocation and mapping management

These files are actually copied from neutron and then modified:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/vlanmanager.py

commit_message:
Add monasca-events-api repo to openstack

Monasca events api project:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Monasca/Events
https://github.com/hpcloud-mon/monasca-events-api

There are tags in PyPI for monasca-events-api and
these are version tags published earlier. We do want
keep these tags when moving into openstack.

Also we don't want to make monasca-events-api to be
an official project in Monasca right now. Maybe we will
make it official later in the future.

All the extra branches have been removed from the repo
Change-Id: Ia376e39b3251e9aad6dd2aa778869ae9b7859e40

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-29 16:40:22.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/ironic-api.yaml', 'network/service_net_map.yaml', 'puppet/services/ironic-conductor.yaml'], 'message': "Fix Ironic service bind IPs

This patch removes the get_input's in the service templates
and instead uses our new bind IP string replacement mechanism
to correctly set the local bind IPs for the Ironic API.

It also avoids using MysqlNetwork to set Ironic my_ip.

This patch adds a new IronicNetwork setting which is used
to control which network Ironic will use for its PXE network
traffic.

Change-Id: Ic848ec77b0106279c5d963504798c05110aa1440
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Ironic service bind IPs

This patch removes the get_input's in the service templates
and instead uses our new bind IP string replacement mechanism
to correctly set the local bind IPs for the Ironic API.

It also avoids using MysqlNetwork to set Ironic my_ip.

This patch adds a new IronicNetwork setting which is used
to control which network Ironic will use for its PXE network
traffic.

Change-Id: Ic848ec77b0106279c5d963504798c05110aa1440

commit_message:
add access_key to share_access_map

For backends with internal authentication system,
e.g. Ceph, that return ``access_key`` (credential) for
client identities that are granted share access:

* Retrieve ``access_key`` as return value of driver's
  update_access()

* Store ``access_key`` in ShareAccessMapping model

* Expose it in access_list API

APIImpact

DocImpact

Partially implements bp auth-access-keys

Co-Authored-By: John Spray <jspray@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I486064f117cf3001dba7735ca92a7d89aee3ce5b

subject: Fixes base_url formatting issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 12:44:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/auth.py', 'tempest_lib/tests/test_auth.py'], 'message': 'Fixes base_url formatting issue

When processing the base_url, if the chosen endpoint does not
contain a trailing slash (e.g. http://10.0.100.141:35357),
it will try to replace:

parts = urlparse.urlparse(_base_url)
...
_base_url = _base_url.replace(parts.path, path)

http://10.0.100.141:35357 having no slash at the end,
parts.path is empty. It will end up replacing path before
each character from _base_url.

Change-Id: I7f49d1e9f656930adf2171cab4e4bfba75e223bd
Closes-Bug: #1568834
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes base_url formatting issue

When processing the base_url, if the chosen endpoint does not
contain a trailing slash (e.g. http://10.0.100.141:35357),
it will try to replace:

parts = urlparse.urlparse(_base_url)
...
_base_url = _base_url.replace(parts.path, path)

http://10.0.100.141:35357 having no slash at the end,
parts.path is empty. It will end up replacing path before
each character from _base_url.

Change-Id: I7f49d1e9f656930adf2171cab4e4bfba75e223bd
Closes-Bug: #1568834

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-31 03:42:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_dhcp_rpc.py'], 'message': "Narrow down DBError to DBReferenceError in DHCP action handler

Commit 85ed7017ff22dd24ef7558010e62598483561354 removed the DBError
handling to let the retry decorator do its magic, however the
full implications of this change were not evaluated. As a result,
DBReferenceError (which derives from DBError) is not processed
correctly and that caused a regression of the existing logic.

Rather than bloat the retry's responsibility even further, this
patch partially reverts commit 85ed7017f by narrowing down the
exception handling to DBReferenceError only.

Related-bug: #1618216

Change-Id: Icf4e5e4145dcdcdc710b8e42044467913ed01ec1
"}]
commit_message:
Narrow down DBError to DBReferenceError in DHCP action handler

Commit 85ed7017ff22dd24ef7558010e62598483561354 removed the DBError
handling to let the retry decorator do its magic, however the
full implications of this change were not evaluated. As a result,
DBReferenceError (which derives from DBError) is not processed
correctly and that caused a regression of the existing logic.

Rather than bloat the retry's responsibility even further, this
patch partially reverts commit 85ed7017f by narrowing down the
exception handling to DBReferenceError only.

Related-bug: #1618216

Change-Id: Icf4e5e4145dcdcdc710b8e42044467913ed01ec1

subject: Added jsdoc3 output to doc generation
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-30 21:39:45.000000000', 'files': ['src/keystone.js', 'doc/source/index.rst', '.gitignore', 'package.json', 'doc/source/reference_documentation.rst'], 'message': "Added jsdoc3 output to doc generation

This patch adds jsdoc3-generated documentation to our docs build.
It does so by using publicly available sphinx.rst templates, writing
them into a .gitignore'd folder in the docs directory, and providing
references to these autogenerated documents in our own site.

There are some notable bugs:
- jsdoc-sphinx templates do not honor @ignore and @private
- jsdoc-sphinx templates do not ignore private variables (listed under
  members at the bottom).
- jsdoc-sphinx templates add superfluous 'Children' section to the
  top as subsection navigation.

It would make quite a bit of sense for us to contribute to
jsdoc-sphinx so that the above mentioned bugs are resolved. However,
as some documentation is better than no documentation, right now this
is fine.

Change-Id: I2905358a6410d5dace96c25dc57dda100fae4b48
"}]
commit_message:
Added jsdoc3 output to doc generation

This patch adds jsdoc3-generated documentation to our docs build.
It does so by using publicly available sphinx.rst templates, writing
them into a .gitignore'd folder in the docs directory, and providing
references to these autogenerated documents in our own site.

There are some notable bugs:
- jsdoc-sphinx templates do not honor @ignore and @private
- jsdoc-sphinx templates do not ignore private variables (listed under
  members at the bottom).
- jsdoc-sphinx templates add superfluous 'Children' section to the
  top as subsection navigation.

It would make quite a bit of sense for us to contribute to
jsdoc-sphinx so that the above mentioned bugs are resolved. However,
as some documentation is better than no documentation, right now this
is fine.

Change-Id: I2905358a6410d5dace96c25dc57dda100fae4b48

commit_message:
Skip volume extend tests if feature is not supported

Some cinder volume backends don't support volume extend,
so this is to use CONF.volume_feature_enabled.extend to skip
volume extend tests when volume backend doesn't support this feature.

Change-Id: If206c243ea68ea4018dce63c865a714a9fd30352

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-29 13:35:03.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-ceph-disk-init-protection-5b38ce8f1502ff69.yaml', 'ansible/roles/ceph/tasks/bootstrap_osds.yml', 'ansible/group_vars/all.yml'], 'message': 'Add a check before wiping Ceph disks in bootstrap

An unwitting user may apply the KOLLA_CEPH_OSD[_CACHE]_BOOTSTRAP label
to a partition assuming it will only use that partition for Ceph, and
end up wiping out their disk.

This change adds a layer of checking to this scenario to try and help
avoid a disaster scenario.

Closes-Bug: 1599103
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibb9fb42f87a76bc02165ec0b93b60234bad8747a
'}]
commit_message:
Add a check before wiping Ceph disks in bootstrap

An unwitting user may apply the KOLLA_CEPH_OSD[_CACHE]_BOOTSTRAP label
to a partition assuming it will only use that partition for Ceph, and
end up wiping out their disk.

This change adds a layer of checking to this scenario to try and help
avoid a disaster scenario.

Closes-Bug: 1599103
DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibb9fb42f87a76bc02165ec0b93b60234bad8747a

subject: Removed request and response interception.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-30 21:24:50.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/util/httpTest.js', 'src/util/http.js'], 'message': "Removed request and response interception.

The request/response interception has not yet been used, and
introduced quite a bit of complexity, especially surrounding fetchMock.
Furthermore, they made our DSVM tests fail, as the browser's implementation
of Request requires that a request body be accessed using the regular
json(), text(), etc. promise generators. Since this would have
simply added more complexity to an already complex, unused feature,
we've simply removed the feature.

Change-Id: I4cdf7b7106c771f0562de47e8835076d48d03a31
"}]
commit_message:
Removed request and response interception.

The request/response interception has not yet been used, and
introduced quite a bit of complexity, especially surrounding fetchMock.
Furthermore, they made our DSVM tests fail, as the browser's implementation
of Request requires that a request body be accessed using the regular
json(), text(), etc. promise generators. Since this would have
simply added more complexity to an already complex, unused feature,
we've simply removed the feature.

Change-Id: I4cdf7b7106c771f0562de47e8835076d48d03a31

The ReScheduler is a decorating class to Python's
sched package Scheduler. Allows scheduling tasks for a
repeated number of times while providing a mechanism
to reschedule differently in case of a task's
failure. The class is now used to reschedule repeatedly
Vitrage's datasources get_all. This allows for better

options for timing them.

Change-Id: I6b9c698af3e2edf0f49762d99ae8aa1e33ddcc38
"}]
commit_message:
ReScheduler class for Vitrage Snapshot Service

The ReScheduler is a decorating class to Python's
sched package Scheduler. Allows scheduling tasks for a
repeated number of times while providing a mechanism
to reschedule differently in case of a task's
failure. The class is now used to reschedule repeatedly
Vitrage's datasources get_all. This allows for better
get all exception\fault management as well as more
options for timing them.

Change-Id: I6b9c698af3e2edf0f49762d99ae8aa1e33ddcc38

To support a rich set of graph analysis methods during strategy
determination we want to have a simple graph model. The graph model
should describe how VMs are associated to compute hosts, how virtual

Implements: blueprint graph-based-cluster-model
'}]
commit_message:
Graph model describing virtual and physical elements in a data center

To support a rich set of graph analysis methods during strategy
determination we want to have a simple graph model. The graph model
should describe how VMs are associated to compute hosts, how virtual
networks entities are mapped to physical networks devices, objects/block
storage objects to physical storage devices.

Change-Id: I2ba0513aacca884540bc0f8f6d49d6b2488b8eaa
Implements: blueprint graph-based-cluster-model

commit_message:
Use plugin obj from neutron manager in the TestMl2PortsV2 unit test

Commit Iedad1ccae45005efaaa74d5571df04197757d07a is recreating
the plugin for the test
TestMl2PortsV2.test_update_port_status_notify_port_event_after_update.
This is failing for the networking-ovn ML2 plugin.

This patch uses the manager.NeutronManager to get the plugin object.

Change-Id: Id48b621eeb9ded5d25c8cbbabbff32d821bd6181
Closes-bug: #1618343

commit_message:
Fix cluster timestamp setting

After creation or update, we failed to update the 'created_at' or
'updated_at' property of a cluster. This was a bug introduced during
recent changes about cluster status update. This patch fixes them.

Change-Id: I1c8ac84ccac5d537f11f0d10f83e012bbbc6632e

commit_message:
Protect node from being deleted when necessary

When a node is being created, deleted, updated or recovered, we should
reject the request to delete it (temporarily).

Closes-Bug:#1564784

Change-Id: Iee88f339d9765206c531407c4cbf93a165ddd78b

commit_message:
Fix SDK log output setting

Always dumping debug output from SDK is a bad idea. We are trying to
reduce some noises during logging from SDK. Ideally, this should be
aligned to the oslo.log setting, but I haven't figured out a way to do
that.

Change-Id: I5f8c127cad9bbd3df5c3a03662c6d590aec73bcb

subject: [kafka] invoke TypeError exception when 'listen()' method of KafkaDriver is called
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-29 07:03:41.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_kafka.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_kafka.py'], 'message': "[kafka] invoke TypeError exception when 'listen()' method of KafkaDriver
is called

The interface of BaseDriver which is a super-class of each underlying
transport driver has been changed.
But the interface of kafka driver doens't follow up this change. So if a
user chose it as a transport driver, an exception of TypeError would be
occurred.
This change corrects the interface in kafka's driver along with the
BaseDriver's one.

Change-Id: Iedd069b7f083e2cbf377f4148411f77ad758f979
Closes-Bug: #1616755
"}]
commit_message:
[kafka] invoke TypeError exception when 'listen()' method of KafkaDriver
is called

The interface of BaseDriver which is a super-class of each underlying
transport driver has been changed.
But the interface of kafka driver doens't follow up this change. So if a
user chose it as a transport driver, an exception of TypeError would be
occurred.
This change corrects the interface in kafka's driver along with the
BaseDriver's one.

Change-Id: Iedd069b7f083e2cbf377f4148411f77ad758f979
Closes-Bug: #1616755

commit_message:
Unify getting properties for method of Server res

Method .get() allows to specify default value. Hovewer it's not used
here and ad extra step, before execute simple call props[key].
Also other similar calls does not use .get(), so let's unify it too.

Change-Id: I83298d0114ac6364ce914587cfdadd1440d75e6f

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-25 17:47:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Changed exception catching order

On [1] InstanceIsLocked is catched. However on [2] InstanceInvalidState
is catched, which is an ancestor of InstanceIsLocked.
For this reason, catching a specific exception is meaningless after
catching the base type (as it will catch sub-types too).

So I changed the order of the catch clauses, which now
catches InstanceIsLocked before InstanceInvalidState, which means
the more specific exception is catched before the more general
exception.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L1111
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L1108

Change-Id: I4c520d485736197c278291c126784f7a8d693756
'}]
commit_message:
Changed exception catching order

On [1] InstanceIsLocked is catched. However on [2] InstanceInvalidState
is catched, which is an ancestor of InstanceIsLocked.
For this reason, catching a specific exception is meaningless after
catching the base type (as it will catch sub-types too).

So I changed the order of the catch clauses, which now
catches InstanceIsLocked before InstanceInvalidState, which means
the more specific exception is catched before the more general
exception.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L1111
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L1108

Change-Id: I4c520d485736197c278291c126784f7a8d693756

commit_message:
Hyper-V: update live migrate data object

The Hyper-V driver does not properly handle shared storage at the moment.

In order to address this, and ensure that proper cleanup is performed
in case of failed live migrations, we'll need to update the
HyperVLiveMigrateData object and make sure that the compute manager
properly uses it.

This change is part of a bigger series, attempting to fix HyperV shared
storage related issues.

Change-Id: I1beb56530134c83b8359ac137cdffc37a86ec8cc
Partial-Bug: #1565895

commit_message:
Increased timeout for Heat autoscaling test

The autoscaling timeout in Ceilometer is 600 seconds,
we need to make sure autoscaling will make an alarm
in Ceilometer withing timeout*2 + several seconds to
pass this test in 100% of cases.

Change-Id: I6b2a43e4acb4b8d76641ee314ca19e67b999500a

commit_message:
Increased timeout for Heat autoscaling test

The autoscaling timeout in Ceilometer is 600 seconds,
we need to make sure autoscaling will make an alarm
in Ceilometer withing timeout*2 + several seconds to
pass this test in 100% of cases.

Change-Id: I6b2a43e4acb4b8d76641ee314ca19e67b999500a
Closes-Bug: #1584190

commit_message:
Add support for vd2 user context to other drivers

This patch adds support for passing the user context through to
vendordata2 to all the other drivers. libvirt got this in the
original patch, so this is a catch up for the others.

Change-Id: I1e1f0aa1a41626970ae3291caaf8d1d1661f68e6
Blueprint: vendordata-reboot

commit_message:
Changed name of supertask deploy

UI expects that name of supertask is deploy.
Also create supertask in running state to improve
responsibility of UI.
Added dry_run and graph_type to task serialization output

Closes-Bug: 1618541

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-29 09:50:36.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "requirements: add missing oslo i18n dep in order

Somehow we were missing this dep. I suspect that another oslo dep was
pulling it anyway, but the policy is that any module that we import
directly should be in our requirements.txt even if it is being pulled
by another dependency (as that dependency could drop the sub dep and
we'd break).

Change-Id: I5d5ee420273d87c73c5c6c8ac806eaea2ce18c2b
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>
"}]
commit_message:
requirements: add missing oslo i18n dep in order

Somehow we were missing this dep. I suspect that another oslo dep was
pulling it anyway, but the policy is that any module that we import
directly should be in our requirements.txt even if it is being pulled
by another dependency (as that dependency could drop the sub dep and
we'd break).

Change-Id: I5d5ee420273d87c73c5c6c8ac806eaea2ce18c2b
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
Drop unused requirements

In the split we forgot to drop some requirementes that belong only to
kuryr-libnetwork. This patch removes all the requirementes that are not
explicitly used in the kuryr.lib namespace.

Change-Id: Ia31c402e90e92802b5f096072799eacfa122aaca
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-01 10:27:39.000000000', 'files': ['inc/ini-config', 'tests/test_ini_config.sh'], 'message': 'Fix iniget_sections to work with subsections

INI files may contain subsections, syntax is described [0]
[A\B] where A is section name, B - is subsection of A.

Running iniget_sections on the following ini file should return
only A.

  [A]
  opt=val
  [A\B]
  opt-1=val-1

This change fix iniget_sections function to get only
section names, names with subsections are ignored.

Reference:
[0] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INI_file#Hierarchy

Change-Id: I601703e0557c3f7a98fc266377c1ba189fb8bc00
'}]
commit_message:
Fix iniget_sections to work with subsections

INI files may contain subsections, syntax is described [0]
[A\B] where A is section name, B - is subsection of A.

Running iniget_sections on the following ini file should return
only A.

  [A]
  opt=val
  [A\B]
  opt-1=val-1

This change fix iniget_sections function to get only
section names, names with subsections are ignored.

Reference:
[0] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INI_file#Hierarchy

Change-Id: I601703e0557c3f7a98fc266377c1ba189fb8bc00

commit_message:
Introduce iniget_subsections and iniget_section_data

Introduce new functions:
  iniget_subsections: get a list of subsections from specified
      ini file, for specified section.
  iniget_section_data: return a string of option=values for
      specified section from specified file

The change is going to be used Ironic to enroll nodes from
INI syntax file.

Change-Id: I3456f3ca02498e8867dfd95e3878f14eeb7efc73
Needed-By: I044dd2754fc0fcff0c8c7a1feaf2ddf492da1251

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:11:04.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/parser/functions/openstack_resource_id_getter.rb', 'spec/functions/openstack_resource_id_getter_spec.rb'], 'message': "Introduce openstack_resource_id_getter function

There are config options that contain openstack resource UUID. For
ironic project the options are:
- swift_account
- cleaning_network_uuid
- provisioning_network_uuid

This commit introduce new function openstack_resource_id_getter. It
accepts resource command string and returns resource UUID. Function uses
Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Auth library.

If this function is used in the traditional master/agent setup where an
openrc or environment variables are not local to the master, a hash of
environment variables can be passed in to set for execution.

Example of usage:
$swift_account = openstack_resource_id_getter('user show swift')
$cnu = openstack_resource_id_getter('network show baremetal')

$creds = {'OS_AUTH_URL' => 'http://keystone.fqdn:5000/v2.0',
          'OS_PROJECT_NAME' => 'admin',
          'OS_USERNAME' => 'admin',
          'OS_PASSWORD' => 'a_big_secret'}
$router_id = openstack_resource_id_getter('router show router1', $creds)

Change-Id: Iaa412f3383f3849cddb134dda6b1fca54e9da972
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce openstack_resource_id_getter function

There are config options that contain openstack resource UUID. For
ironic project the options are:
- swift_account
- cleaning_network_uuid
- provisioning_network_uuid

This commit introduce new function openstack_resource_id_getter. It
accepts resource command string and returns resource UUID. Function uses
Puppet::Provider::Openstack::Auth library.

If this function is used in the traditional master/agent setup where an
openrc or environment variables are not local to the master, a hash of
environment variables can be passed in to set for execution.

Example of usage:
$swift_account = openstack_resource_id_getter('user show swift')
$cnu = openstack_resource_id_getter('network show baremetal')

$creds = {'OS_AUTH_URL' => 'http://keystone.fqdn:5000/v2.0',
          'OS_PROJECT_NAME' => 'admin',
          'OS_USERNAME' => 'admin',
          'OS_PASSWORD' => 'a_big_secret'}
$router_id = openstack_resource_id_getter('router show router1', $creds)

Change-Id: Iaa412f3383f3849cddb134dda6b1fca54e9da972
Co-Authored-By: Vasyl Saienko <vsaienko@mirantis.com>

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-27 09:23:33.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I0dd6c8c859ff4370c8ab463c49bbcb46fbd3a06f
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I0dd6c8c859ff4370c8ab463c49bbcb46fbd3a06f

commit_message:
Use uuid to match router port when delete router interface

Currently, deleting router interface will delete all router ports
in the same network in df db. This patch fix that by matching uuid
when deleting router interface.

Change-Id: I12169442ba90be9ccac8fe133fc88459bc84a1ef
Closes-bug: #1616851

When users attempt to change a LBaaS resource while the load

commit_message:
Set HTTP status code to 409 for LBs in PENDING*

When users attempt to change a LBaaS resource while the load
balancer is in a PENDING-* state they currently get an error
with a 500 HTTP status code.  This patch changes the status code
to be 409 (conflict) which is consistent with other "I'm busy"
errors.

Change-Id: I6fc0c966e72dde956bd481b71a5cea5ba6d10c55
Closes-Bug: #1570596

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: Ic4adc7064a1d9bf306a784c37db8d1d59b0c70ff

subject: Add action-id to output of node-delete
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-04 04:27:36.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/node.py'], 'message': "Add action-id to output of node-delete

When I delete one or more node at one time, the output is 'Request
accepted'.
I got confused, as I can't figure out which actions are dealing with the
deletion.
I recommend adding action-ids to output of node-delete. Additionally, we
should output the action-ids in all requests using actions.

Change-Id: I93c81e387786daf3682ed57de4a8756c2bfe184b
Closes-Bug:#1564711
"}]
commit_message:
Add action-id to output of node-delete

When I delete one or more node at one time, the output is 'Request
accepted'.
I got confused, as I can't figure out which actions are dealing with the
deletion.
I recommend adding action-ids to output of node-delete. Additionally, we
should output the action-ids in all requests using actions.

Change-Id: I93c81e387786daf3682ed57de4a8756c2bfe184b
Closes-Bug:#1564711

subject: Move properties_data into a separate table
revisions:
[{'number': 43, 'created': '2016-08-22 16:53:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat/objects/resource_properties_data.py', 'contrib/rackspace/rackspace/tests/test_cloud_loadbalancer.py', 'heat/db/api.py', 'heat/objects/event.py', 'heat/objects/resource.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/074_resource_properties_data.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource.py', 'heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_event.py', 'heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/tests/test_stack.py', 'heat/tests/convergence/framework/testutils.py', 'heat/engine/event.py', 'heat/tests/db/test_migrations.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_api_utils.py'], 'message': 'Move properties_data into a separate table

Properties data (encrypted or not) is now stored in the
resource_properties_data table. We still support reading properties
data from the legacy locations (separate columns in the resource and
event tables) but all new properties data are written to
resource_properties_data.

Instead of duplicating properties data for a given resource
and its events, we refer to the same resource_properties_data
object from both resources and events.

Notes about encrypting/decrypting properties data:

1. ResourcePropertiesData methods take care of encrypting/decrypting.
2. Resource objects do not have to worry about encrypting due to 1.
2a. resource._stored_properties_data and resource.rsrc_prop_data.data
    are always decrypted (in the context of heat.engine.resource or
    heat.object.resource).
3. Previously (not anymore), heat.engine.resource would take care of
   the encrypting in _store() and _store_or_update().
4. Previously and currently, heat.object.resource decrypts the legacy
   properties_data field if needed.

Change-Id: I0c29f0235b284fdf3452cab0dd47ca48f31e70af
Closes-Bug: #1524013
'}]
commit_message:
Move properties_data into a separate table

Properties data (encrypted or not) is now stored in the
resource_properties_data table. We still support reading properties
data from the legacy locations (separate columns in the resource and
event tables) but all new properties data are written to
resource_properties_data.

Instead of duplicating properties data for a given resource
and its events, we refer to the same resource_properties_data
object from both resources and events.

Notes about encrypting/decrypting properties data:

1. ResourcePropertiesData methods take care of encrypting/decrypting.
2. Resource objects do not have to worry about encrypting due to 1.
2a. resource._stored_properties_data and resource.rsrc_prop_data.data
    are always decrypted (in the context of heat.engine.resource or
    heat.object.resource).
3. Previously (not anymore), heat.engine.resource would take care of
   the encrypting in _store() and _store_or_update().
4. Previously and currently, heat.object.resource decrypts the legacy
   properties_data field if needed.

Change-Id: I0c29f0235b284fdf3452cab0dd47ca48f31e70af
Closes-Bug: #1524013

commit_message:
Treat ODL's 404 hostconfigs, as an empty list
On pseudo agent db, when odl response with 404 not_found for hostconfigs,
treat it as an empty list rather then an error.
Issue a debug log in this flow

Closes-Bug: 1608654
Change-Id: I96f4d0ed0edb1f6907af36f51eb9ed81b5a08ecc

commit_message:
Python 3.x compatibility ConfigParser

OpenStack code should become Python 3.x compatible:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#python-3-x-compatibility
Following table contains the renamings and reorganizations of the standard library using six.moves:
http://python3porting.com/stdlib.html#removed-modules

Increase description column length in task table

table from TEXT to LONGTEXT but forgot to do the same
for similar column in the task task table

commit_message:
Type name resolution was fixed

After the new contract framework and new property validation
workflow were introduced type name resolution broke. As
a result if the creating class is in different than the created
property validation will fail. This commit fixes it.

Change-Id: I2fdf7bb5e5d6af73acaaabdd65c7d676a180a7a2
Closes-Bug: #1618563
